intro: Trichospira biaristata, commonly known as the two-spined spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, green, egg-shaped leaves and yellow-orange flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The sap of Trichospira biaristata contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans.
